alert.note: Alert for Greater Lake Tahoe Area (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 15 at 4:01AM PST until January 17 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Reno
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations of 8 to 18 inches, except 1 to 3 feet above 7000 feet. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph in the lower elevation and up near 80 mph across Sierra ridgetops. * WHERE...Greater Lake Tahoe Area. * WHEN...Until 10 AM PST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel will be very difficult this morning. Conditions will improve during the day but will deteriorate again tonight into Monday morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A lull in activity will occur through most of today. A second burst of heavy snow is possible tonight into Monday morning.
info.instruction: Avoid travel if possible, you could be stuck in your vehicle for many hours. If you must travel, prepare for long delays and carry an emergency kit with extra food, water and clothing. If you stay home, have a backup plan in case of power outages. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
